| HistoryText             = The Hex-Men was a group of alternate [[X-Men]] with ties to the arcane who were coaxed into servitude by the [[Madelyne Pryor (Earth-91240)|Goblin Queen]] of [[Earth-91240]] with the false promise of being helped in exchange for their assistance in her schemes.{{r|X-Men: Blue Vol 1 10|12}}

After traveling to the [[Earth-616|Prime Earth]] via a spell cast by [[Henry McCoy (Earth-616)|the young, time-displaced Beast]] living there,{{r|X-Men: Blue Vol 1 10}} the Hex-Men attacked the [[X-Men (Time-Displaced) (Earth-616)|X-Men]]'s [[X-Mansion (Madripoor)|Mansion]] in [[Madripoor]], and captured some of them to be used in a ritual fueled by the pain of betrayal to summon other [[Madelyne Pryor|Goblin Queens]] from throughout the [[Multiverse]].{{r|X-Men: Blue Vol 1 11}}

Realizing through the nature of the ritual that the Goblin Queen's promises were hollow, [[Ororo Munroe (Earth-21710)|Bloodstorm]] betrayed her and made Beast see reason, prompting him to conjure a spell to cast the Goblin Queen away. While the other Hex-Men were teleported with her, Bloodstorm remained behind, presumably due to her betrayal severing any bonds she had with Pryor. She was then offered a spot on the team by [[Scott Summers (Earth-616)|Cyclops]].{{r|X-Men: Blue Vol 1 12}}
